question: According to the author, how does Cross Entropy contribute to miscalibration?
answer_format: Your answer should be a string.
reasoning_steps: First, locate the part of text that discusses the contribution of Cross Entropy to miscalibration
Second, find the contribution of Cross Entropy to miscalibration mentioned in this part of text.

eval_kwargs.question: According to the author, how does Cross Entropy contribute to miscalibration?
eval_kwargs.reference_answer: According to the author, Cross Entropy contributes to miscalibration by encouraging the model to assign a probability of 1 to the ground-truth token and 0 to all other tokens. This leads to overestimating the probability of the correct token (over-confidence) and underestimating the probabilities of the other tokens (under-confidence), causing miscalibration during the fine-tuning process.
